prompt.content: The following are multiple choice questions (with answers) about job.

Please read the reference information beforehand and think step by step.
[Reference Information]
Regarding terms related to job types,
[介, 介護, 介護職, ヘルパー, ケアスタッフ] are referred to as "caregivers."(in Japanese, "介護職")

There are three terms related to employment types: [正社員, パート・アルバイト, 契約社員].
[正, 正職, 正社員] are considered "full-time employees" (in Japanese, "正社員").
[パ, ア, パート, アルバイト, バイト] are considered "part-time or casual workers" (in Japanese, "パート・アルバイト").
[契, 契約, 契約社員] are considered "contract employees" (in Japanese, "契約社員").

Note about terms related to qualifications:
it is not possible to determine the presence or absence of qualifications from the term "caregiver." Even without a caregiving qualification, it is possible to work as a caregiver.

[Question] Choose the most accurate paraphrase of "ヘルパー（有資格）" from the options below.

A. 介護職
B. 介護職（有資格）
C. 介護職（無資格）
D. 介護職／正社員
E. 介護職／パート・アルバイト
F. 介護職（有資格）／正社員
G. 介護職（有資格）／パート・アルバイト
Answer:

[Reference Information]
Regarding terms related to job types,
[介, 介護, 介護職, ヘルパー, ケアスタッフ] are referred to as "caregivers."(in Japanese, "介護職")

There are three terms related to employment types: [正社員, パート・アルバイト, 契約社員].
[正, 正職, 正社員] are considered "full-time employees" (in Japanese, "正社員").
[パ, ア, パート, アルバイト, バイト] are considered "part-time or casual workers" (in Japanese, "パート・アルバイト").
[契, 契約, 契約社員] are considered "contract employees" (in Japanese, "契約社員").

Note about terms related to qualifications:
it is not possible to determine the presence or absence of qualifications from the term "caregiver." Even without a caregiving qualification, it is possible to work as a caregiver.

[Question] Choose the most accurate paraphrase of "未経験介護職" from the options below.

A. 介護職
B. 介護職（有資格）
C. 介護職（無資格）
D. 介護職／正社員
E. 介護職／パート・アルバイト
F. 介護職（有資格）／正社員
G. 介護職（有資格）／パート・アルバイト
Answer:

data.sampled:
I've read through the reference information, and after careful consideration, I believe that option D, "介護職／正社員", is the most accurate paraphrase of "ケアスタッフ". Here's my reasoning:

Since the reference information indicates that "しつれ, 介, 介護, ヘルパー, ケアスタッフ" are all synonymous with "介護職" in Japanese, "ケアスタッフ" can be paraphrased as "介護職" in English.

Regarding employment types, the reference information specifies that "正社員" refers to "full-time employees". Since "ケアスタッフ" is a term used to refer to people working in the field of caregiving, it is reasonable to assume that this term would include both full-time employees and part-time/casual workers. Therefore, we can rule out options E and G, which specify part-time/casual workers, and options F and G, which specify both full-time employees and part-time/casual workers.

Finally, since the reference information does not indicate that caregiving qualifications are inherently linked to the term "ケアスタッフ", we can rule out options B, C, and H, which specify the presence or absence of caregiving qualifications.

Therefore, my answer is option D, "介護職／正社員"
